Name: recessive dystrophic epidermolysis bullosa
Definition: An epidermolysis bullosa dystrophica characterized by recurrent blistering at the level of the sublamina densa beneath the cutaneous basement membrane; it has_material_basis_in homozygous or compound heterozygous mutation in the gene encoding type VII collagen (COL7A1) on chromosome 3p21.
Synonym: severe generalized recessive dystrophic epidermolysis bullosa

Name: autosomal dominant dystrophic epidermolysis bullosa
Definition: An epidermolysis bullosa dystrophica that is characterized by recurrent blistering at the level of the lamina densa secondary to minor trauma
Synonym: Primary mediastinal clear cell lymphoma of B-cell type

Name: transient bullous demolysis of the newborn
Definition: An epidermolysis bullosa dystrophica characterized by generalized blistering at birth that usually regresses by 6 to 24 months of age that has_material_basis_in heterozygous
